comment: ignore the 5 people who claim she's awful because she's the best professor i've had at KSU. She reminds me of a nice high school teacher almost, her assignment are very easy and well thought out, she's not a tough grader and if you complete the assignments you should get an A. she also has multiple opportunities for extra credit

Dr. Oberlton is one of the best professors I've taken ever!! She is very caring, thoughtful, sincere, and is passionate about the success of her students. Make sure you complete assignments and read the material in the book. Her group assignments were interesting and really helped me to retain the material discussed in class.

Very good and easy professor. Tests are on D2L and there is a weekly writing about a chapter in the textbook but it's only 1 paragraph long. She is a stickler about exact MLA formatting though. Some group projects and mandatory attendance but the projects were very fun. Sometimes she goes offtrack but she'll never force the extra work on you. 10/10

Dr. O was a great professor this semester. Yes, there was a lot of work but it was easy and knowledgeable. She posted grades at a timely manner and all assignments were posted on time or before time. Highly recommended. She also provided extra credit work as well.

Dr. O was very sweet. The class was ridiculously easy. It's basically just writing reflections on your own sex life (which is super weird but whatevs). The tests come straight from the powerpoints and aren't under lockdown so you can just search the powerpoints for the answers

Dr. Oberlton is the best/sweetest professor ever! The class was very easy, only one day a week, and all the work was online. There is about 3 hours of work online per week, but most of it is done for completion. As long as you complete the online assignments every week, you are promised an A. She also gives you 10+ opportunities for extra credit.

I barely made an A in her class, because I forgot to do a handful of assignments. She does do extra credit though. Quizzes were hard, so make sure you read each chapter and take notes. Pay attention to the questions asked on the powerpoints from the bearclaw program.
The best Wellness teacher, she is sooo sweet. It's a lot of work I won't lie, but it's so easy. Each week consists of a couple of assignments and a quiz and the semester long project. It's an EASY A

Took her for HPE 3250. LOVED her! She's an amazing teacher & gives lots of extra credit. Easy A just complete all assignments on time (she tells you exactly what she's looking for) & show up to class bc she only allows 2 absences before she starts deducting points (chances are you will have plenty of pts to sacrifice if you need to be absent more).

Hey! I hope this helps someone. I took the Wellness 1000 online with Dr. Oberlton. More busy work as others have mentioned. Do the work because she does not accept late work. The tests are open book. I got an A in her course just because I did the work. I promise it is an easy class. It is a lot but she gives like 2 weeks to get it done.
The homework is all in Bearface and wasn't too hard, but there is a ton of it. Get ready to spend hours doing homework. Easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. O is very kind and specific during her lectures. Although she gives all the assignments at one time (they take sometimes 20 hours for one module), she does not accept late work whatsoever. Has fun and interesting classes and requires attendance in cooking demos and other fun stuff like that. Get ready to work and read.
A lot of fun activities that help understand material. She's very outgoing and understanding. Quick to respond to emails and she posted grades pretty fast as well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Best Professor I've had since I have been here at Kennesaw.

Take her if you want a great grade on top of actually learning the material and enjoying the class. Very understanding teacher. What her syllabus says is exactly how she runs her class. So I had no issues with her at all.

Gives out extra credit during class periods, so show up, it really helps grades. Also gives study guides that are perfect for studying for exams. Only 3 exams, 3rd exam is the final. Lots of fun activities, that help you learn the material easily.

She's the best. Responds quickly to emails. Grades fast. Makes class enjoyable. Wants you to actually learn and enjoy the class and takes the steps for that to happen. Gives study guides which helps ALOT for test. She's very funny and makes you comfortable with wanting to be involved in class participation.

Dr.O is absolutely amazing, if you have the option take her. Her lectures were interesting and she's incredibly helpful. There's always extra credit too. She allows the use of notes on tests for 15 minutes, makes lecture guides for her lectures which are easy to use and can be used on the tests. She's very understanding and always willing to help.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Oberlton is nice, mature, and educated. I took her for Honors WELL 1000. If you can take this class online, I highly recommend it, but if not, it's super easy and she offers plenty of extra credit. Several online quizzes but no lockdown browser. You have to buy the online textbook which is around $170. Easy A and I never took notes.

I took Dr. Oberlton for a summer semester, the work was fairly easy. Make sure to look over the material at the beginning of the week to make sure you do the discussions (if there are any) when they are due. Lots of reading, but if youre willing to do the work its an easy A!
Easy A! Might as well take her for a dumb GenEd class.

She is a great professor. The class is very straight forward and everything is online so it is easy. There are 6 modules and she gives you 2-3 weeks to complete each one. The module check-ins take a long time to complete but if you answer the questions you will get an A. Overall very easy and not time consuming.
EASY A for wellness. Modules due every week or so. No tests or quizzes. Very sweet lady who cares about her students. Just do the work!!!

She was always ready to teach and always had a positive energy. She just gave out too much pop quizzes. However, there was a lot of extra credit opportunity that made up for the poor quiz grades. If you just do what you are suppose to and take the class serious, you will pass with an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This class was easy. I took this online and she is a very helpful professor. She doesn't ask for a lot and her instructions are very straight forward. Do the work and you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's a good teacher, but I really underestimated her ability to lecture about wellness for three hours straight during the summer semester. She takes the class very seriously and likes participation. Still an easy class, but she assigns a lot of homework.

Nice lady. Her class wasn't too hard but attendance is mandatory. Alot of group mini-assignments in class, and be ready for a lot of physical activity. Gives some leeway, just do the work--it's not really hard, especially if it's a hybrid

I enjoyed this class and I learned so more than expected. There are lots of participation in activities to assist with submitting accurate info for assignments. Professor gives clear instructions and details of her expectations for each assignment.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: A good teacher, but I honestly suggest you do not take a hybrid class. Bearface (the online platform we used) gave me so many issues. Nothing against the teacher though, but I would have done better in a twice a week in-class environment.

I took this class as a hybrid. It was a breeze! You have at least 2 weeks to complete each module, which is plenty of time. She makes it clear what she wants. However, she doesn't accept late work, unless you have an extremely legitimate reason. I'd definitely take her again!
Most of the class consists of online modules, very easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I would simply not take this teacher.  Too much work for a required wellness class.

This online class has so much more work than the classroom class.  Labs due weekly and quizes with only 1 chance that are impossible to find the answers to.  Her tests are also hard with most people getting b's and c's.
This class is lab overload.  You have so many labs to fill out every week and tedious quizzes that are very detailed oriented.  Tests are hard too.  Challenging class.

You have to buy Bearface code, not on D2L and read chapters and do many, many labs that are never ending.  Tests and quizzes are quite difficult and tedious.  Labs are very detailed and take a long time to complete.  Hard class for required class.  There are easier teachers like Smith.
The labs are tedious and she grades harshly.  If you miss the deadline, you lose 100 points.  Don't take her.    Tests are hard.

Took this online in the summer and got an A on every assignment, extra credit is a breeze too. You can get away with not reading the chapters and BS-ing it all, even the physical activities. You must buy the Bearface code to be in the class, she doesn't use D2L. Piece of cake, easy A,  raised my GPA with little effort, highly recommend!!

She will work with you on things, so communicate if you have an issue. I submitted the wrong assignment accidentally & was able to email a screenshot of the timestamp on the correct assignment so I could resubmit. Obviously don't make a habit of having problems, but she will help. Her assignments are simple & quick, easy A if you do all the work.
Labs are graded harshly and in the summer you have to do 3 labs a week  plus quizzes and reading.  Lots of work for the summer .  Bettter to take in fall or spring due to work load.

Easy A. I've made 100's on almost everything. Just make sure you fill out your healthy living checkins effectively because they are worth a lot of points. No need to read the long textbook that she claims takes 2 hrs to read every chapter. (However you have to buy it for bear face) No test so it doesn't matter. 3 extra credit opportunities
Great teacher. Easy A.

Oberlton makes this course far from easy. Every assignment is taken completely seriously, and you must participate in all fitness assignments. These assignments were hours upon hours worth of going to the gym and doing pointless activities that have nothing to do with my major. If you're hardcore into fitness, this is the professor for you.

Hybrid class, easiest A to get. All assignments are online, no tests, participation is key, extra credit is provided. Always answers emails, I made a 99.8 in the class, as long as you turn in assignments by the deadline, you should pass .

Dr. Oberlton is the sweetest professor I've had. I took her WELL 1000 hybrid class which was super easy. No tests or quizzes. All work is online except a few pop ticket-in-the-doors. She explains every step for every assignment. She gives easy extra credit. There's no final! I would definitely recommend her and would take her again in a heart beat.
She's a really nice teacher. She really wants to help her students and understands life happens so if you just talk to her she will work to help you.

I was annoyed when I first found out this course was mandatory (I'm a xfer student). However, after taking Dr. Oberlton's course, all of that changed. I took her hybrid class. There are no "paper" finals. But u will have quizzes to take. You NEED the book! Miss class 4x, u get dropped. Heard after summer semester the course will change. Loved her!

I took this class as a hybrid. Dr. Oberlton was a great teacher. She's super helpful and very nice. She doesn't require you to come to class, however she told us at the beginning of the semester that if you miss 4 classes you will fail (especially if we're doing a labphysical activity that day). I would recommend taking her. Easy A!
